fields.summary: When copying a file out of HDFS, modifying it, and uploading it back into HDFS, the put fails due to a CRC mismatch

fields.description: {{ViewFileSystem#setVerifyChecksum}} is a no-op.  It should call {{setVerifyChecksum}} on the mount points.

comments.body: Had to make a few changes to prevent {{FilterFileSystem}} from mangling the scheme  to the underlying filesystem's scheme.  This caused {{ViewFileSystem}} to instantiate the underlying {{FileSystem}}.  These bugs also blocked being able to write tests with a custom {{FileSystem}}.
In addition to common tests, ran tests in hdfs and mapreduce that used {{LocalFileSystem}}, {{FilteredFileSystem}}, {{ChRootedFileSystem}}, {{ViewFileSystem}}, {{HarFileSystem}}, etc.

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12513184/HADOOP-8013.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 9 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/563//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/563//console

This message is automatically generated.
The patch looks good to me, and all of the tests pass, including the tests in mapred and hdfs.  +1
Thanks for the patch.  I just committed this to trunka nd 0.23

Files : 
* /hadoop/common/trunk/hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/CHANGES.txt
Marking incompatible per HADOOP-8105.

For future reference, would you please explain the criteria for an incompatible change?  I was under the belief that an incompatibility is marked in the release notes as something that will require customers to change code?  HADOOP-8054 (dup of HADOOP-8015) restored the previous behavior with no need for customer code change.
